cinnamon.engine.system

Class MouseEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • cinnamon.engine.system.Event
      • cinnamon.engine.system.InputEvent
        • cinnamon.engine.system.MouseEvent

  • public final class MouseEvent
extends InputEvent

    MouseEvents represent InputEvents generated by mouse interaction and are described by the MouseEvent.Button that performed the InputEvent.Action as well as the screen coordinates of the cursor at the time of the action. Unlike KeyEvents, MouseEvents support all Actions.

    While the MouseEvent.Button.MIDDLE Button supports InputEvent.Action.PRESS and InputEvent.Action.RELEASE, it is also capable of acting on InputEvent.Action.SCROLL_FORWARD and InputEvent.Action.SCROLL_BACKWARD. It is the only Button capable of doing so.

      Mouse button constants for describing MouseEvents.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MouseEvent

        public MouseEvent(MouseEvent.Button button,
                  InputEvent.Action action,
                  float x,
                  float y)

        Constructs a MouseEvent described by a MouseEvent.Button, the Action taken on the button, and the position of the Event on the screen.

        Parameters:
        button - either MouseEvent.Button.LEFT, MouseEvent.Button.RIGHT, or MouseEvent.Button.MIDDLE.
        action - Action such as Action#PRESS.
        x - x.
        y - y.

      • MouseEvent

        public MouseEvent(MouseEvent event)

        Constructs a MouseEVent by copying another.

        Parameters:
        event - MouseEvent to copy.

      • isButton

        public final boolean isButton(MouseEvent.Button button)

        Checks whether or not the MouseEvent is described by a specified MouseEvent.Button

        Parameters:
        button - button constant such as MouseEvent.Button.LEFT.
        Returns:
        true if the button describes the MouseEvent.

      • isScrollBackward

        public final boolean isScrollBackward()

        Checks whether or not the MouseEvent is described by Action#SCROLL_BACKWARD.

        Returns:
        true if SCROLL_BACKWARD event.

      • isScrollForward

        public final boolean isScrollForward()

        Checks whether or not the MouseEvent is described by Action#SCROLL_FORWARD.

        Returns:
        true if SCROLL_FORWARD event.

      • update

        public final void update(MouseEvent.Button button,
                         InputEvent.Action action,
                         float x,
                         float y)

        Changes the MouseEvent.Button, Action, and (x,y) position.

        Timestamp is not copied but updated to the time of this method's execution.

        Parameters:
        button - either MouseEvent.Button.LEFT, MouseEvent.Button.RIGHT, or MouseEvent.Button.MIDDLE.
        action - either Action#PRESS, Action#RELEASE, Action#REPEAT, Action#SCROLL_FORWARD, or Action#SCROLL_BACKWARD.
